values.help: If not zero, automatically switch off after a user defined time
values.label: Automatically switch off after

values.help: Defines how to interpret RF Off command. Can be used in conjunction with Auto Off function: Ignore - to switch on the light by motion detectors and switch it off after some amount of time: in case of multiple motion detectors each would try to switch the light off that would break logics; Switch on - to switch on the light on both On and Off paddle press on the remote and switch it off after some amount of time. Button off click will still work (if button operations are not disabled).
values.label: What to do on RF off command

items.label: Switch on if load is off else switch off (v1.8)

values.help: Defines if the dimmer shall ignore start level in StartLevelChange command despite it is specified or not.
values.label: Ignore Start Level

values.help: Time to dim on button presses and Set command (if it has no duration specified). If not 0, dimming will be done smoothly to preserve bulb life.
values.label: Dimmer speed

values.help: Time to dim on button holds and StartLevel Change command (if it has no duration specified).
values.label: Dimming long speed

values.help: Defines if the dimmer shall set maximum light level on On command. By default on On command dimmer restores last level. This parameter allows to configure to set maximum level on second On command (if already On) or to always switch on to maximum level.
values.label: Set Maximum Light on On click

values.help: Time to dim on double click Off  button for Baby- Dim function. This function works only if the load is operated by single press and hold button action. If enabled, the device will wait for a click timeout to see if the second click would be pressed. This will introduce a small delay for single click commands, unprotected.
values.label: Baby Dimming Time

values.help: Target level on which to stop while executing Baby Dimming. Can be 0 to completely switch off the light.
values.label: Target Dimming Level for Baby Dimming

values.help: Typical time used to differentiate click, hold, double and triple clicks.
values.label: Typical click timeout

values.help: If disabled, the local operations by buttons will not switch the load, but only send commands to On/Off association group. In  this mode buttons are not linked with the switch anymore. They can be used separately: buttons to control remote device, switch will operate by RF commands only.
values.label: Switch by buttons

values.help: Defines which command should be sent on button single press or hold. Basic and Scene Activation commands are sent to Association group. Use Scene Controller Conf to set up Scene ID for Scene Activation. Switch All commands are sent broadcast.
values.label: Action on button single press or hold

items.label: Send Basic Set and Switch Multilevel (v1.8)

values.help: Defines which command should be sent on button double press or press-hold. Basic and Scene Activation commands are sent to Association group. Use Scene Controller Conf to set up Scene ID for Scene Activation. Switch All commands are sent broadcast. If not disabled, the device will wait for a click timeout to see if the second click would be pressed. This will introduce a small delay for single click commands.
values.label: Action on button double press or hold

items.label: Send Basic Set and Switch Multilevel (v1.8)

values.label: Send the following Switch All commands

values.help: Maximum level should be greater than minimal level. Set to 0 to work as a switch (off or full on only), or set to 10 - 99
values.label: Limit maximal light level (v1.8)

values.help: Set to 0 to use previous light level, or set to 1 - 99
values.label: Switch On on a defined level (v1.8)

values.help: NB: Do not touch these settings if you are not sure what they mean! For dimmable LEDs and CFL with bypass use value 1. For other bulbs use default value.
values.label: Pause before pulse (v1.8)

values.help: NB: Do not touch these settings if you are not sure what they mean! For dimmable LEDs and CFL with bypass use value 40. For other bulbs use default value.
values.label: Pause after pulse (v1.8)

values.help: NB: Do not touch these settings if you are not sure what they mean! For dimmable LEDs and CFL with bypass use value 20. For other bulbs use default value.
values.label: Pulse width (v1.8)

values.help: NB: Do not touch these settings if you are not sure what they mean!
values.label: Pulse type (v1.8)
